title: Pune Metropolitan Region
text:
Pune Metropolitan Region (PMR) is the metropolitan region around the city of <a href="Pune">Pune</a>. According to practical purposes, PMR comprises two <a href="Municipal%20Corporations%20in%20India">Municipal Corporations</a> of <a href="Pune%20Municipal%20Corporation">PMC</a> and <a href="Pimpri-Chinchwad%20Municipal%20Corporation">PCMC</a> and three <a href="Cantonment%20Board">Cantonment Board</a>s, spread over an area of 7,256.46 km2. The population of the region as per <a href="2011%20Census%20of%20India">2011 census</a> was 7,541,946.
The <a href="Pune%20Metropolitan%20Region%20Development%20Authority">Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority</a> (PMRDA) is the planning and development authority of the region formed. PMRDA is headed by the <a href="Chief%20minister%20of%20Maharashtra">Chief minister of Maharashtra</a> (presently by <a href="Uddhav%20Thackeray">Uddhav Thackeray</a>. Suhas Diwase, <a href="Indian%20Administrative%20Service">IAS</a>, is the <a href="chief%20executive%20officer">chief executive officer</a>). The authority is responsible for various town planning schemes, <a href="Pune%20Ring%20Road">Pune Ring Road</a> as well as <a href="Pune%20Metro%23Line%203%20Hinjawadi%20%28Hinjawadi%20Phase-I%2C%20II%2C%20III.%20Including%20Maan%2C%20Pune%20%26amp%3B%20Bhoirwadi%29%20%E2%80%93%20Civil%20Court">Pune Metro (Line 3)</a>.
Jurisdiction.
PMR is spread over 3 <a href="Tehsil">talukas</a> of the <a href="Pune%20district">Pune district</a>. It includes the entirety of <a href="Pune%20City%20Taluka">Pune City</a> and <a href="Pimpri%20Chinchwad">Pimpri Chinchwad</a> talukas, and the <a href="Dehu%20Road">Dehu Road</a> cantonment of <a href="Haveli%20taluka">Haveli</a> taluka. The prominent <a href="Local%20self-government%20in%20India%23Urban">urban local self-governing bodies</a> in the region are as follows:
